intro: Phaeocephalus gnidioides, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and woody stems. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible for some animals but toxic to others. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
